remarks.format: ## Remarks 泛型类是具有 O （log `n`）检索的键/值对的数组，其中 n 是字典中的元素数。The generic class is an array of key/value pairs with O(log `n`) retrieval, where n is the number of elements in the dictionary. 在这种情况下，它类似于 的泛型类。In this, it is similar to the generic class. 这两个类具有相似的对象模型，并且都具有 O （log `n`）检索。The two classes have similar object models, and both have O(log `n`) retrieval. 这两个类的不同之处在于内存使用和插入和删除的速度：Where the two classes differ is in memory use and speed of insertion and removal: - 比 使用的内存更少。 uses less memory than . - 对于未排序的数据，O （log `n`）， 具有更快的插入和删除操作，而不是 的 O （`n`）。 has faster insertion and removal operations for unsorted data, O(log `n`) as opposed to O(`n`) for . - 如果列表是从已排序数据一次填充的，则 比 快。If the list is populated all at once from sorted data, is faster than . 和 类之间的另一个区别在于， 支持通过 和 属性返回的集合高效索引检索键和值。Another difference between the and classes is that supports efficient indexed retrieval of keys and values through the collections returned by the and properties. 访问属性时无需重新生成列表，因为这些列表只是键和值的内部数组的包装器。It is not necessary to regenerate the lists when the properties are accessed, because the lists are just wrappers for the internal arrays of keys and values. 下面的代码演示如何使用 属性从字符串的排序列表中检索值的索引：The following code shows the use of the property for indexed retrieval of values from a sorted list of strings: key. 每个元素都可以作为 对象进行检索。Each element can be retrieved as a object. 密钥对象必须是不可变的，只要它们用作 中的密钥。Key objects must be immutable as long as they are used as keys in the . 中的每个键都必须是唯一的。Every key in a must be unique. 不能 `null`键，但如果列表的值的类型 `TValue`，则值可以为引用类型。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be, if the type of values in the list, `TValue`, is a reference type. 需要一个要进行排序和执行比较的比较器实现。 requires a comparer implementation to sort and to perform comparisons. 默认比较器 检查键类型是否 `TKey` 实现 并使用该实现（如果可用）。The default comparer checks whether the key type `TKey` implements and uses that implementation, if available. 如果不是， 将检查密钥类型是否 `TKey` 实现 。If not, checks whether the key type `TKey` implements . 如果键类型 `TKey` 未实现任何一个接口，可以在接受 `comparer` 参数的构造函数重载中指定一个 实现。If the key type `TKey` does not implement either interface, you can specify a implementation in a constructor overload that accepts a `comparer` parameter. 的容量是 可以容纳的元素数。The capacity of a is the number of elements the can hold. 将元素添加到 时，将根据需要通过重新分配内部数组来自动增加容量。As elements are added to a , the capacity is automatically increased as required by reallocating the internal array. 可以通过调用 或显式设置 属性来减少容量。The capacity can be decreased by calling or by setting the property explicitly. 减少容量会重新分配内存，并复制 中的所有元素。Decreasing the capacity reallocates memory and copies all the elements in the . **仅 .NET Framework：** 对于非常大的 对象，可以通过将[``](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/gcallowverylargeobjects-element.md)配置元素的 `enabled` 属性设置为运行时环境中的 `true`，来将64位系统上的最大容量增加到2000000000个元素。**.NET Framework only:** For very large objects, you can increase the maximum capacity to 2 billion elements on a 64-bit system by setting the `enabled` attribute of the [``](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/runtime/gcallowverylargeobjects-element.md) configuration element to `true` in the run-time environment. C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）返回集合中元素的类型的对象。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) returns an object of the type of the elements in the collection. 由于 的元素是键/值对，因此元素类型不是键的类型或值的类型。Since the elements of the are key/value pairs, the element type is not the type of the key or the type of the value. 而是 元素类型。Instead, the element type is . 例如：For example: [!code-cpp[Generic.SortedList#12](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/cpp/remarks.cpp#12)] [!code-csharp[Generic.SortedList#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/CS/remarks.cs#12)] [!code-vb[Generic.SortedList#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/VB/remarks.vb#12)] `foreach` 语句是枚举器周围的包装器，它仅允许从集合读取，而不允许写入。The `foreach` statement is a wrapper around the enumerator, which only allows reading from, not writing to, the collection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用字符串键创建一个空的字符串 ，并使用 方法添加一些元素。The following code example creates an empty of strings with string keys and uses the method to add some elements. 该示例演示了在尝试添加重复键时 方法引发了 。The example demonstrates that the method throws an when attempting to add a duplicate key. 该示例使用 属性（中C#的索引器）来检索值，演示在请求的键不存在时引发 ，并显示与键关联的值可以替换。The example uses the property (the indexer in C#) to retrieve values, demonstrating that a is thrown when a requested key is not present, and showing that the value associated with a key can be replaced. 该示例演示如何使用方法作为更高效的方法来检索值，如果程序必须经常尝试在已排序的列表中，不并显示如何使用方法来测试某个键是否存在之前调用方法。The example shows how to use the method as a more efficient way to retrieve values if a program often must try key values that are not in the sorted list, and it shows how to use the method to test whether a key exists before calling the method. 该示例演示如何枚举已排序列表中的键和值，以及如何使用 属性和 属性单独枚举键和值。The example shows how to enumerate the keys and values in the sorted list and how to enumerate the keys and values alone using the property and the property. 最后，该示例演示 方法。Finally, the example demonstrates the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 使用内部树按排序顺序维护字典。The dictionary is maintained in a sorted order using an internal tree. 每个新元素都置于正确的排序位置，并且在每次删除元素时，都会调整树来维护排序顺序。Every new element is positioned at the correct sort position, and the tree is adjusted to maintain the sort order whenever an element is removed. 在枚举时，将保留排序顺序。While enumerating, the sort order is maintained. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对的后续调用 返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 或 的下一次调用引发了 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用下面的语法通过此属性访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[key]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[key]`. 不能 `null`键，但如果列表的值的类型 `TValue`，则值可以为引用类型。A key cannot be `null`, but a value can be, if the type of values in the list, `TValue`, is a reference type. 如果在检索值时找不到该密钥，则会引发 。If the key is not found when a value is being retrieved, is thrown. 如果在设置值时找不到该键，则添加键和值。If the key is not found when a value is being set, the key and value are added. 你还可以使用 属性来添加新元素，方法是设置 中不存在的键的值;例如，`myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the ; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果 中已经存在指定的键，则设置 属性将覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the , setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反， 方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. C#语言使用[`this`](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md)关键字来定义索引器，而不是实现 属性。The C# language uses the [`this`](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md) keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值是一个 O （log `n`）操作，其中 n 是 的。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(log `n`) operation, where n is . 如果键已在 中，则设置属性是 O （log `n`）操作。Setting the property is an O(log `n`) operation if the key is already in the . 如果键不在列表中，则为未排序的数据设置属性是 O （`n`）运算，如果在列表的末尾添加新元素，则为 O （log `n`）。If the key is not in the list, setting the property is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, or O(log `n`) if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入操作导致大小调整，则操作为 O （`n`）。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 属性（中C#的索引器）来检索值，演示在请求的项不存在时引发 ，并显示与键关联的值可以替换。The following code example uses the property (the indexer in C#) to retrieve values, demonstrating that a is thrown when a requested key is not present, and showing that the value associated with a key can be replaced. 该示例还演示了如何使用 方法作为一种更有效的方法来检索值（如果程序经常必须尝试排序列表中不是的键值）。The example also shows how to use the method as a more efficient way to retrieve values if a program often must try key values that are not in the sorted list. 此代码示例是为 类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 属性返回一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 的访问。The property returns an object that can be used to synchronize access to the . 仅当所有线程在访问集合之前锁定此对象时，同步才有效。Synchronization is effective only if all threads lock this object before accessing the collection. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 或 的下一次调用引发了 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用 `foreach` 语句（`For Each` Visual Basic 中 `for each` 中C++的）枚举排序列表中的键/值对，后者隐藏了枚举器的使用。The following code example shows how to enumerate the key/value pairs in the sorted list by using the `foreach` statement (`For Each` in Visual Basic, `for each` in C++), which hides the use of the enumerator. 特别要注意的是， 接口的枚举器将返回 对象，而不是 对象。In particular, note that the enumerator for the interface returns objects rather than objects. 此代码示例是为 方法提供的更大示例的一部分，包括输出。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements. 具有固定大小的集合就是一个集合，其中包含阻止添加和移除元素的包装;因此，如果对基础集合进行了更改，包括添加或删除元素，则固定大小的集合将反映这些更改。A collection with a fixed size is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents adding and removing elements; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, including the addition or removal of elements, the fixed-size collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在创建只读集合后，该集合不允许添加、移除或修改元素。A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created. 只读集合就是一个集合，其中包含阻止修改集合的包装器;因此，如果对基础集合进行了更改，只读集合将反映这些更改。A collection that is read-only is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes. 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `key` 的类型不能分配给 的键类型 `TKey`，则此属性将返回 `null`。This property returns `null` if `key` is of a type that is not assignable to the key type `TKey` of the . 可以使用下面的语法通过此属性访问集合中的特定元素：`myCollection[key]`。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: `myCollection[key]`. 你还可以使用 属性来添加新元素，方法是设置字典中不存在的键的值;例如，`myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`。You can also use the property to add new elements by setting the value of a key that does not exist in the dictionary; for example, `myCollection["myNonexistentKey"] = myValue`. 但是，如果字典中已存在指定的键，则设置 属性会覆盖旧值。However, if the specified key already exists in the dictionary, setting the property overwrites the old value. 与此相反， 方法不会修改现有元素。In contrast, the method does not modify existing elements. 该C#语言使用[this](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md)关键字来定义索引器，而不是实现 属性。The C# language uses the [this](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/this.md) keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the property. Visual Basic 将 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality. 检索此属性的值是一个 O （log `n`）操作，其中 n 是 的。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(log `n`) operation, where n is . 如果键已在 中，则设置属性是 O （log `n`）操作。Setting the property is an O(log `n`) operation if the key is already in the . 如果键不在列表中，则为未排序的数据设置属性是 O （`n`）运算，如果在列表的末尾添加新元素，则为 O （log `n`）。If the key is not in the list, setting the property is an O(`n`) operation for unsorted data, or O(log `n`) if the new element is added at the end of the list. 如果插入操作导致大小调整，则操作为 O （`n`）。If insertion causes a resize, the operation is O(`n`). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用具有 的 接口的 属性C#（中的索引器），以及该属性与 属性不同的方式。The following code example shows how to use the property (the indexer in C#) of the interface with a , and ways the property differs from the property. 该示例显示，与 属性一样， 属性可更改与现有键关联的值，如果指定键不在排序列表中，则可用于添加新的键/值对。The example shows that, like the property, the property can change the value associated with an existing key and can be used to add a new key/value pair if the specified key is not in the sorted list. 该示例还演示了与 属性不同的是，如果 `key` 不在排序列表中， 属性不会引发异常，而是返回空引用。The example also shows that unlike the property, the property does not throw an exception if `key` is not in the sorted list, returning a null reference instead. 最后，该示例演示如果 `key` 不是正确的数据类型，则获取 属性返回空引用; 如果 `key` 不是正确的数据类型，则设置属性将引发异常。Finally, the example demonstrates that getting the property returns a null reference if `key` is not the correct data type, and that setting the property throws an exception if `key` is not the correct data type. 此代码示例是为 方法提供的更大示例的一部分，包括输出。The code example is part of a larger example, including output, provided for the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 若要再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 并接着调用 。To set to the first element of the collection again, you can call followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 或 的下一次调用引发了 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized. 此方法为 O （1）操作。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果没有新元素添加到集合中，则可以使用此方法最大程度地减少集合的内存开销。This method can be used to minimize a collection's memory overhead if no new elements will be added to the collection. 但重新分配和复制大型 的成本可能很大，因此，如果列表的容量超过90%，则 方法不会执行任何操作。The cost of reallocating and copying a large can be considerable, however, so the method does nothing if the list is at more than 90 percent of capacity. 这样可以避免因相对较小的收益而产生较大的重新分配成本。This avoids incurring a large reallocation cost for a relatively small gain. 此方法是一个 O （`n`）操作，其中 `n` 是 的。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is . 若要将 重置为其初始状态，请在调用 方法之前调用 方法。To reset a to its initial state, call the method before calling method. 修整空 会将 的容量设置为默认容量。Trimming an empty sets the capacity of the to the default capacity. 还可以使用 属性设置容量。The capacity can also be set using the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法将 方法和 属性的功能组合在一起。This method combines the functionality of the method and the property. 如果未找到该键，则 `value` 参数将获取值类型 `TValue`的适当默认值;例如，对于整数类型，为零（0），对于布尔类型 `false`，对于引用类型为 `null`。If the key is not found, then the `value` parameter gets the appropriate default value for the value type `TValue`; for example, zero (0) for integer types, `false` for Boolean types, and `null` for reference types. 此方法执行二进制搜索;因此，此方法是 O （log `n`）操作，其中 `n` 是 的。This method performs a binary search; therefore, this method is an O(log `n`) operation, where `n` is . ## Examples 该示例演示如何使用 方法，以便在经常尝试排序列表中不是的键的程序中检索值。The example shows how to use the method as a more efficient way to retrieve values in a program that frequently tries keys that are not in the sorted list. 相反，此示例还演示了在尝试检索不存在的键时C#， 属性（中的索引器）如何引发异常。For contrast, the example also shows how the property (the indexer in C#) throws exceptions when attempting to retrieve nonexistent keys. 此代码示例是为 类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. remarks.format: ## Remarks 中的值的顺序与 中的顺序相同。The order of the values in the is the same as the order in the . 返回的 不是静态副本;相反， 引用原始 中的值。The returned is not a static copy; instead, the refers back to the values in the original . 因此，对 所做的更改将继续在 中反映出来。Therefore, changes to the continue to be reflected in the . 属性返回的集合提供了一种有效的方法来按索引检索值。The collection returned by the property provides an efficient way to retrieve values by index. 访问属性时无需重新生成列表，因为列表只是内部值数组的包装器。It is not necessary to regenerate the list when the property is accessed, because the list is just a wrapper for the internal array of values. 下面的代码演示如何使用 属性从字符串的排序列表中检索值的索引：The following code shows the use of the property for indexed retrieval of values from a sorted list of strings: [!code-cpp[Generic.SortedList#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/cpp/remarks.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[Generic.SortedList#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/CS/remarks.cs#11)] [!code-vb[Generic.SortedList#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Generic.SortedList/VB/remarks.vb#11)] 检索此属性的值的运算复杂度为 O(1)。Retrieving the value of this property is an O(1) operation. ## Examples 此代码示例演示如何使用 属性枚举已排序列表中的值，以及如何枚举已排序列表中的键和值。This code example shows how to enumerate the values in the sorted list using the property, and how to enumerate the keys and values in the sorted list. 该示例还演示了如何使用 属性来高效索引检索值。The example also shows how to use the property for efficient indexed retrieval of values. 此代码示例是为 类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class.
